question: Jessica has a flower bed that is 166 meters long. Jessica wants to fill her flower bed with plants. Jessica's flowers grow 5 inches wide so she needs to leave 9.25 meters between every plant. Jessica already owns 16 flowers. Each flowering plant costs €5 at the store, how much money will Jessica spend at the store to fill up her flower bed?
answer:
Jessica's flower bed is 166 meters / 9.25 meters per plant = <<166/9.25=17>>17 plants needed.
Jessica needs to buy 17 plants - 16 plants = <<17-16=1>>1 plants needed to purchase.
Jessica will spend 1 plants * €5 = €<<1*5=9>>9.
#### 9
